newsitem.title: USA: New toys for 1996 - emphasis on GROSS!.
newsitem.headline: New toys for 1996 - emphasis on GROSS!.

text.p: The one word that might sum up many of the toys and other items in demand this coming holiday season is gross! In child-speak, that translates into the delight of bubbling brains, slime and rubber chickens.

From Pressman Toy Corp. comes the Domino Rally Mad Lab Set, the newest addition to the Domino Rally series. Here, tumbling dominoes set off a series of events that culminate with, you've got it, bubbling brains.
Starting with the eerie eyeball, the falling dominoes trigger an oozing tongue from the head of the Mad Scientist, then go to the cauldron and the aforementioned grand finale.
The Domino Rally Mad Lab Set comes with 200 dominoes and accessories. It is recommended for ages six and up. It sells for about $25.95.
For more information, contact Pressman Toy Corp. in New York at 212-675-7910.

Natural Science Industries Ltd., a Long Island, N.Y.- based toymaker, is introducing the Creature Feature Project-o-Scope. This projection machine allows children to view live creatures or microscope slides at many times their actual size by projecting the object on a wall.
The Creature Feature set contains three standard-sized microscope slides, three live specimen holders, an ant house, brine shrimp, instructions and a coupon to order ants.
The projector requires four C batteries, which are not included.
Creature Feature is recommended for ages seven and up.

Ugly Buggies, also from NSI, helps children study bugs, which they have preserved using a special solution that is included. The set includes bug cocoons, magnifier, portable display, tray and instructions. It is recommended for ages five and up.
For prices and other information, contact NSI at 516-678-1700.

The Brainstorms catalogue offers many new humorous toys catering to the goo and slime lover. The Slime Chemistry Kit teaches young chemists to use ordinary household ingredients, such as cornstarch and nail polish remover, to make slime.

The instruction booklet contains information for performing eight activities, as it teaches about colloids, polymers and solvents. The kit is recommended for ages eight and up, with adult supervision. It costs $29.95.
The catalogue also carries the classic rubber chicken, a favourite of practical jokers since the beginning of time. It is recommended for ages five and up and costs $7.95.
To order, get more information or a copy of the Brainstorms catalogue, call 1-800-231-6000.
For an extreme in outdoor activities, Mad River Rocket Co. Inc., a Vermont-based company, has developed the Extreme Sled.
It works like skis and snowboards, except it is contoured for the whole body, not just the feet. The rider kneels on the sled to manoeuvre it down a snowy hill.
The Extreme Sled's low centre of gravity allows for quick runs down the slopes. It is currently being introduced into major toy stores nationwide. It costs about $49.95.
Keep your dog safe and prohibit it from jumping off the back of your pickup truck with a new product, Leash O'Life, from Johnson Pet-Dor.
This pet restraint system lets the dog move freely around the bed of the truck but keeps it from falling or jumping off.
Leash O'Life can be used for dogs of any size. It costs $49 and can be ordered from the Oxnard, Calif.-based company by calling 1-800-457-3911.
